sda only: I installed it on 'all' of them

If you read carefully, it says to install to all *drives*. It doesn't hurt to install to the partitions, they will just be ignored (unless you had windows on one of those partitions, in which case it's now unbootable)
I will install windows on my 80 GB , so I did the right thing by installing on all?
No, you almost never want to install grub to a partition rather than the MBR. It just hasn't done any damage if you don't use windows.

QOS stands for Quality Of Service, it's not a single protocal. Many protocals can be used to manage QOS.
